main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects were observed over the Pacific Ocean near Hawaii on 13 September 1963.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 10 minutes and involved bright lights that resembled a chrome finish., The object appeared about 1/3 the size of the moon and was stationary on or near the horizon., Navigators noted it was star-like in the handle of the Dipper., Observations indicated potential classifications as natural, familiar aircraft, astronomical, or satellite., Two USAF pilots observed additional circular objects shortly before this sighting, moving west to east at high speeds.
sighted object: bright light with a chrome finish, circular objects
